definition: strike or hit heavily and repeatedly
example: Pounding on the door, she shouted at the top of her voice.

definition: (of behaviour or actions) not proper or appropriate
example: He spent unseemly amounts of money on himself.

definition: contrary to reason or common sense; utterly absurd or ridiculous
example: It was a preposterous idea, and no one took it seriously.

definition: an unfair or resented demand or burden
example: Your kids can stay with me the night you're away—it's really not an imposition.

definition: wild or distraught with fear, anxiety, or other emotion
example: She was frantic with worry.

definition: anticipate with great apprehension or fear
example: Jane was dreading the party.

definition: 1. not dependent on the mind for existence; actual 2. something you are trying to achieve
example: Our reveries are shaped by our transactions with the objective world. The main objective is to give more information.

definition: consider one thing to be the same as or equivalent to another
example: Some parents equate education with exam success.

definition: to measure precisely
example: She carefully calibrated the dosage of a medicine.

definition: climb up stairs, a hill, or other rising surface
example: He mounted the stairs.

definition: go up or climb
example: She ascended the stairs.

definition: bring together a group of people for a meeting
example: The prime minister convened his cabinet.

definition: search for mineral deposits; possibility; future outlook
example: The company is prospecting for gold. There is no immediate prospect of peace.

definition: to grow or appear suddenly
example: New towns are springing up to house the increasing population.

definition: obtain a substance from something by a special method
example: Lead was extracted from the copper.

definition: a small rocky body orbiting the sun
example: Asteroids are numerous in outer space.

definition: positioned in or relating to the sky or outer space
example: The moon is a celestial body.

definition: cause someone to feel embarrassed or humiliated
example: She was mortified to see her wrinkles.

definition: move about in search of or as if in search of prey
example: Black bears prowl the canyons.

definition: sleep; to lie dormant or latent
example: Sleeping Beauty slumbered in her forest castle.

definition: to dislike or feel angry toward someone for something
example: I don't grudge her the opportunities.

definition: the intention or desire to do evil; ill will
example: I bear no malice towards anybody.

meaning_cn: 沉闷的；阴郁的；令人沮丧的
definition: dull, bleak, and lifeless; depressing
example: I hate the dreary round of working.

meaning_cn: 欣然接受（信仰、理论、改变）
definition: accept or support willingly and enthusiastically
example: Much of the population quickly embraced Islam.

definition: very skilled or proficient at something
example: He was adept at using computers.

definition: move with a smooth wave-like motion
example: Her body undulated to the thumping rhythm of the music.

definition: made in an intricate shape or decorated with complex patterns
example: She doesn't like ornate jewelry.

definition: serious and unrelenting, especially in authority
example: A smile transformed his stern face.

definition: to praise someone or something highly
example: The essay exalts the simple beauty of the country.

definition: stop or slow down the progress of something undesirable
example: Efforts were made to check the disease.

definition: to produce tears, light, blood, etc.
example: She shed a few tears at her daughter's wedding. The trees shed their leaves in autumn.

definition: move or cause to move continuously through a closed system
example: The fan circulates hot air around the oven.

definition: enough or more than enough; plentiful
example: There is ample time for discussion.

definition: a person who believes in and tries to explain an idea
example: He is an exponent of vegetarianism.

meaning_cn: 越来越快的，呈几何数增长的
definition: very fast; increasingly rapid
example: There has been an exponential increase in world population.

definition: surround a place with armed forces to capture it
example: The town had been besieged for two months.

definition: grand and impressive in appearance
example: He's an imposing man with a powerful voice.

definition: to make someone or something lively or excited
example: A smile animated his face.

definition: alight or rest on something; a place where a bird rests; a high seat
example: A herring gull perched on the rails.

definition: a substance used for killing insects
example: Many pests are resistant to the insecticide.

definition: occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous
example: Although she made intermittent movie appearances.

definition: existing in something as a permanent or characteristic attribute
example: Any form of mountaineering has its inherent dangers.

definition: to bring into danger or allow principles to be lowered
example: Defeat would compromise their chances. Don't compromise your beliefs.
